results.title: Dracula: cinematic scrapbook
results.brief_description: A diverse collection of rare film trailers and film trivia on Count Dracula, the world’s most illustrious vampire. This documentary charts the legend of Dracula from its origins in Hungarian folklore to Bram Stoker’s famous novel “Dracula”, F. W Murnau’s unauthorised film version of this novel, Nosferatu, eine Symphonie des Grauens (1922), as well as Tod Browning’s famous Hollywood treatment of the subject, which brought Hungarian stage actor Bela Lugosi to prominence. Discusses how the popularity of monster films in the 1950’s saw the myth of Dracula being exploited in films such as Mother Riley meets the Vampire (1952), and Billy the Kid versus Dracula (1966). The resurrection of the genre came when the Hammer Studios in England revamped the story of Dracula in colour with a new leading man, Christopher Lee, in Terence Fisher’s Horror of Dracula (1958). This effectively spawned a barrage of films with vampire content, some of which actively sought to cash in on the popularity of the blaxploitation and kung-fu genres, resulting in films such as Blacula (1972) and Legend of the Seven Golden Vampires (1974). The leading men who portrayed Dracula on-screen, most notably, Bela Lugosi and Christopher Lee, are also discussed in detail.

results.title: Dr. Elizabeth Kubler Ross
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Monday Conference”.
Dr Elizabeth Kubler-Ross explains her treatment of the problems surrounding death and dying. She also details ways of dealing with the particular problems involved in coming to terms with the death of a young child

results.title: Dr Leakey and the dawn of man
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Noxon and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Highlights the discoveries of Dr Leakey and their implications for the study of human origins. Traces the development of the first theories about both the emergence of humans and their place of origin and examines the application of modern technology to the study of anthropology. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Dr Heidegger's experiment
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Short story showcase”.
An adaptation of Nathaniel Hawthorne’s symbolic tale of a wise old doctor who proves to his friends that age and wisdom are not necessarily synonymous.

results.title: Down to earth
results.creator_credit: David Morgan, Kestrel Films (Australia) and Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works
results.brief_description: Shows how a large city such as Melbourne disposes of its enormous amount of waste water every day. Looks at the processes involved in sewage treatment and in particular, the work carried out at the Werribee Sewage Treatment Farm. Narrated by Charles Tingwell. Suitable for lower secondary level.
